Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bombinin H2 (XXA, Leu-rich; natural AMPs; UCLL1c; toad, amphibians, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: C-terminal NH2; Note that the abundance of amino acid at position 1 is Leu (54%) and Ile (46%). Structure was determined in SDS or DPC (Toxicon. 2008; 52(2):246-54). Active against Gram- E. coli D21 or D22 (lethal conc 4.4-21.4 uM), Y. pseudotuberculosis YPIII (LD 7.3 uM), P. syringae pv tabaci (32 uM), E. agglomerans Bo-1S (30.1 uM), Gram+  B. megaterium Bm11 (1.4 uM), S. aureus Cowan I (4.7 uM), S. lentus (2.0 uM), M. luteus (2.0 uM), fungi C. albicans ATCC 10231 (3.1 uM), C. guiller-mondii (1.3 uM), C. tropicalis (11 uM) (Mangoni ML et al. 2007).   Also active against C. jeikeium ATCC BAA-949 (MIC 8 uM) (Bruno Casciaro et al., 2020).  It also showed anticancer effect on lung cancer cells (Swithenbank  et al., 2020).  Updated 3/2018; 7/2020.
Literature Information.Author: Mignogna G, Simmaco M, Kreil G, Barra D.1993
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial and haemolytic peptides containing D-alloisoleucine from the skin of Bombina variegata
